quest.name: In Shadow's Wake
journal: The watcher would discuss grave matters with you.
objectives: Search for your comrades at the Watcher's Palace.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Before we speak at length, I believe a change of surrounds is in order.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: I have more than ill tidings to share, you see. I sensed others arriving not long ago.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Though my communions with Hydaelyn have grown infrequent, I have learned enough from Her to know these are your comrades.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: And as luck would have it, they have already reached my abode. Come, let us join them.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Dare I ask what happened before we arrived?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: May we presume this being is a native of the moon?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Yes, they are indeed the three I sensed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank goodness you are unharmed.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We did what we could to subdue the tempered before making our way here.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Not without casualties, unfortunately. Some few detonated explosives, killing themselves and others.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The contingent's healers had their hands full tending to the injured and enthralled when we took our leave.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, Mistress Krile hath also been delivered unto their care. Serving as a conduit for Hydaelyn's power hath taken its toll, but she will recover in due course.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As for Alphinaud and Alisaie, they insisted on remaining in Garlemald while we three rushed to your aid. It appears, however, that matters here have already come to a conclusion...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But what manner of conclusion, if I might ask? And is this the ally whom Hydaelyn bade you seek out? He is not unlike the shades of Amaurot.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: Not unlike, perhaps, but not the same. I was created by Hydaelyn, together with this place. It has ever been my duty to keep vigil over Zodiark. Or rather, it was my duty...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then Zodiark is no more!?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: And not without consequence, I am afraid, for now the delicate weave of the star, preserved by His presence, will begin to unravel.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: If you mean to avert the Final Days, you shall have need of─

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Are you all right!?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: My attempts to forestall Zodiark's release have all but exhausted my strength.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: If you might allow me to rest a short while, I will share with you all I can.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Please do. You need not exert yourself on our account.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: These crystals contain records of your time here, yes? May we peruse them while we wait?

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: By all means. If you would review them chronologically, might I suggest beginning with those on the upper floor?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I shall leave that to you, Forename, while I see what can be gleaned from the crystals on these lower levels.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Zodiark defeated... While He may have been in an incomplete state, that's nevertheless an impressive feat.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But even if you hadn't, His demise was inevitable─Fandaniel would've seen to it one way or another.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That said, he probably would have wielded Zodiark's power to wreak untold destruction before taking his own life, making this the better of two unfavorable outcomes.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Dost thou suppose our host hath maintained his solitary vigil since the very beginning, without rest or relief?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If so, these records comprise the sum total of his existence. We must needs handle them with care.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Pray review the records on the upper floor, and I will see if there is aught to be learned down here.

dialogue.name: WATCHEROFMOON
dialogue.text: A moment longer, friend...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you gaze into the crystal, ancient knowledge of Zodiark flows through your mind...

dialogue.name: MEMORYA04399
dialogue.text:
(-Crystalline Memories-)Daily summary: no abnormalities detected...
Daily summary: no abnormalities detected...
Daily summary: no abnormalities detected...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These appear to be records of a long, lonely vigil on the moon, dating back to the beginning of Zodiark's imprisonment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you gaze into the crystal, knowledge of past calamities flows through your mind...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The records describe how, with each Rejoining, Zodiark's thirst for freedom grew, as did the strain on the brands.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Maintaining Zodiark's imprisonment appears to tax Hydaelyn greatly...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you gaze into the crystal, knowledge of past Rejoinings flows through your mind...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The records describe the watcher's efforts to prepare in the event Zodiark broke free from His prison.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The records go on to describe maintenance carried out regularly with the “Loporrits,” though it is not clear who or what they are.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you gaze into the crystal, a record of an unexpected visitor flows through your mind...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The records note the watcher's musings when Elidibus is spotted on the moon, though clearly not for the first time.

dialogue.name: MEMORYB04399
dialogue.text: (-Crystalline Memories-)It is clear he and his brethren have a keen interest in freeing Zodiark from His prison, and yet they have made no attempt to destroy the brands. Perhaps they prefer He remain hidden from mortal eyes until the final Rejoining.

dialogue.name: MEMORYB04399
dialogue.text: (-Crystalline Memories-)Perhaps they realize we would never dare bring harm to Zodiark, so long as He remains imprisoned.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Did you learn anything of import?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: So it is as we suspected. Maintaining the brands requires a great deal of Her energy and focus─and this cost has grown higher with every Rejoining.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That would explain why contact with Her has become rather infrequent since the Seventh Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I too made a rather startling discovery...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This heavenly body we know to be the moon was in fact created by Hydaelyn!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: When the watcher said he was created together with this place, I thought he only meant this facility... Truly, Hydaelyn's powers are far beyond anything I could have imagined.
